dublin_core.dcvalue: BACKGROUND The smartphone used in Vietnam has become increasingly popular in recent years with adolescents and youths being one of the groups with the heaviest use Health related applications on mobile phones or mobile health mHealth applications appear to be a feasible approach for disease and health management especially for self management However there has been a scarcity of research on the mobile phone usage for health care among youths and adolescents OBJECTIVE This study aims to identify the patterns of usage of smartphone applications and the preferences for functionalities of smartphone based health related applications among Vietnamese youths METHODS An online cross sectional study was conducted in Vietnam in the period of August to October 2015 Web based Respondent driven sampling technique RDS was adopted to recruit participants The online questionnaire was developed and distributed using Google Form Chi squared and Mann Whitney test was used to investigate the difference in attitude and preference for smartphone apps between two genders RESULTS Among 356 youths sampled low prevalence of using mHealth apps was found such as beauty counseling 7 6 nutrition counseling 8 4 disease prevention 11 1 and disease treatment 8 2 Majority of users found the app useful 72 7 and reported satisfaction with the app 61 9 No significant differences were found between the genders in their perception of the usefulness of applications and their satisfaction with mobile health applications Most of the participants 68 6 preferred apps which are conceptualized and designed to run on a smartphone as compared to web based smartphone apps and 50 preferred visuals materials About 54 4 reported that it was integral for the smartphone apps to have a sharing social network functionality Participants with higher perceived stress score and EQ 5D index were significantly less likely to use mHealth apps CONCLUSIONS This study found the low proportion of using mHealth related smartphone apps but a high level of receptiveness and satisfaction among Vietnamese youths Acceptance level and preferences toward mHealth apps as well as specifically preferred functionalities discovered in this study are essential not only in the conceptualizing and developing appropriate smartphone interventions targeting youths and adolescents but also in the application of technical advanced solutions in disease prevention and health management
What drives young Vietnamese to use mobile-health innovations? Implications for health communication and behavioral interventions.
